name: Powerball Winning Data 2010
title: Powerball Winning Data 2010

api_list.name: /multiplier
api_list.description: The 'multiplier' endpoint from the API 'PowerballWinningData2010' provides you with a list of possible values for a specific field called 'multiplier'. This field represents a special feature in the Powerball game, where you can multiply your winnings by a certain factor. The endpoint returns an array of strings, which are the possible values for the multiplier.These values are not limited to specific numbers; the endpoint can return a wide range of options between 100 and 200. The endpoint allows you to see all the available multipliers that might have been used in past Powerball games. It provides valuable information for calculating potential winnings or understanding the various multiplier options offered by the game.Remember that the examples mentioned (2, 5, 5) are just for illustration purposes and not actual values returned by the endpoint. By accessing this endpoint, you can explore the different multiplier options within the specified range and make informed decisions when playing Powerball.

api_list.name: /drawDate
api_list.description: The 'drawDate' endpoint in the PowerballWinningData2010 API provides an array of strings that represent the dates when Powerball draws took place. Each string value represents a specific draw date in the format of MM/DD/YYYY. This endpoint is designed to offer users all the possible values for the 'drawDate' field, allowing them to access historical Powerball draw dates.By utilizing this endpoint, users can easily fetch a comprehensive list of draw dates for Powerball results across multiple years. The array of strings returned by this endpoint enables users to programmatically or manually retrieve the specific draw dates they require for various purposes. Whether it's for statistical analysis, tracking patterns, or personal interest, this endpoint provides a user-friendly way to obtain detailed information about the dates on which Powerball draws occurred.

api_list.name: /winningNumbers
api_list.description: The 'winningNumbers' endpoint from the 'PowerballWinningData2010' API provides an array of strings representing the winning numbers for Powerball lottery draws. Each string in the array corresponds to a specific lottery draw and contains a series of numbers separated by spaces. These numbers represent the winning balls selected during the respective Powerball draw.By accessing this endpoint, you can retrieve all the possible values for the 'winningNumbers' field, which allows you to analyze historical Powerball results. This endpoint helps users access a wide range of winning number combinations, enabling them to study patterns, trends, and frequencies of specific numbers, and in turn, make informed decisions or predictions for future Powerball draws.Please note that the examples given above (24 25 34 37 54 29 14 41 50 56 57 18 05 06 29 35 51 21) are just for illustration purposes and are not part of the actual description of the endpoint.

api_list.name: /records
api_list.description: The 'records' endpoint is a crucial part of the 'PowerballWinningData2010' API, designed to provide users with valuable information related to Powerball lottery results. When making a request to this endpoint, users can specify certain query parameters to filter the data they receive. The endpoint responds with an array of objects that represent rows of lottery records, tailored according to the specified query parameters.By utilizing the 'records' endpoint, users gain access to a wealth of data about Powerball winning numbers, dates, prize amounts, and other relevant details. This valuable information can be utilized in numerous ways, such as analyzing past results, studying patterns, or even predicting potential outcomes for future Powerball draws. Whether you are an avid lottery enthusiast, a researcher, or a curious individual, the 'records' endpoint allows you to explore and understand the historical data associated with Powerball winnings.With this endpoint, users can effortlessly retrieve specific records that meet their criteria, enabling them to extract meaningful insights and make informed decisions. The 'records' endpoint serves as a gateway to a comprehensive library of Powerball data, helping users unravel the fascinating intricacies of this immensely popular lottery game.
